title: New tools will help Global members become 'immersed' in product
text:
New tools will help Global members become 'immersed' in product 23 July 2015 Save 
Members of The Global Travel Group are to be given a raft of new marketing tools as a result of the consortium’s new advisory panel. 
The group’s Global Advisory Panel (Gap), which was set up in March, includes both senior management and agency members, and has just met for the second time. 
Among the latest moves is the development of a customer relationship management (CRM) system, which is being trialled by Gap members, who will give suggestions on how it can be improved before it is rolled out to Global’s 400-plus members. 
Global has also started offering members one-to-one social media training, including help with setting up pages, content management, video and online advertising. 
Agency members have called for more product “immersion” and Global is working with airlines, tourist boards and cruise lines to increase the number of fam trips available. 
Global managing director Andy Stark, who chairs Gap meetings, said: “It’s great to have the chance to work with the new advisory panel. 
“With the range of members involved, a number of different views, perspectives and feedback points are brought to the table. 
“The aim of the panel is to offer feedback and help shape future decisions. It’s great that we are able to listen, learn from their first-hand experience and take action.” 
Global plans to hold Gap meetings on a quarterly basis.
